Article.ArticleTitle: Synthesis of Flavone Derivatives via N-Amination and Evaluation of Their Anticancer Activities.

AbstractText: Seventeen new flavone derivatives substituted at the 4'-OH position were designed, synthesized and evaluated for their anticancer and antibacterial activities. Among them, compounds 3, 4, 6f, 6e, 6b, 6c and 6k demonstrated the most potent antiproliferative activities against a human erythroleukemia cell line (HEL) and a prostate cancer cell line (PC3). The results also showed that the IC50 value of compounds 3, 4, 6f, 6e, 6b, 6c and 6k were close to that of the anticancer drug cisplatin (DDP) and lower than that of apigenin. All of the derivatives did not present antibacterial activities. The structure-activity relationships evaluation showed that the configuration of methyl amino acid might affect their biological activities.
